title: Camille
body:
Edit: This post was 24 days old.

Camille is broken in terms of her E cd. Everything else is fine imo, I rarely lose to her.

replies.body:
Huge mobility, gets a shield for a % of her max hp, does true damage which negates building resistances and does %HP damage which negates building HP to counter true damage, has a displacement ult that you can use like a Gragas ult to split a team up and the target cannot escape from except in very few interactions with other champs (stops Ekko and Vi R which went through Azirs wall) can jump over almost any wall in the game, oh and lets give her a ranged slow so she can peel chase while waiting for her enormous dash to come back up which also heals her for a % of her HP which is almost double Darius heal and isnt capped like his is.

Did I forget anything? Oh yeah she also has a stun.  What is this champion missing?

Overall if they remove her %hp or her true damage that would give a build path vs her, atm there is none except Deaths Dance and Phantom Dancer which is not optimal for a lot of champs.

She had minor nerfs patched in (base AD down by 2 and true damage lowered early)

I honestly think Camille should only get healed if she hits a champion with the W not anything. You can take a bad trade, spam W on the wave and get half your HP back.

My honest opinion is why in the hell does she have almost everything available in the game? A shield, a heal, %HP damage, True Damage, A dash, a stun, a slow, attack speed buff, movespeed buff... she is pretty much the new, even more stacked Irelia.


-----------------------------

Rengar was bugfixed since his passive was giving him %AD based on TOTAL instead of just BONUS. So he should do less damage. But I think they need to tone down his healing a little. Or make it so his Q doesnt let him dash a little. The number of Rengos than spam that to run away is ridic.

I used to think Katarina was horrendously broken. But having played her a couple more times she isn't that bad. Don't get me wrong, a good Katarina has VERY little counterplay, but your average Kat is easy to beat now I find.
